content:
What a great idea! Creating a playlist specifically for your jogs with Rachel can make the experience even more enjoyable and motivating.

For a leisurely 5-mile jog pace, you'll want songs with a consistent beat and tempo that match your footsteps. Here are some song recommendations with a tempo range of 120-140 BPM, which is suitable for a moderate-intensity jog:

1. **Upbeat Pop/Rock**:
	* Walk the Moon - "Shut Up and Dance" (128 BPM)
	* Imagine Dragons - "On Top of the World" (130 BPM)
	* The Script - "Hall of Fame" (128 BPM)
	* OneRepublic - "Counting Stars" (122 BPM)
	* Maroon 5 - "One More Night" (128 BPM)
2. **Indie/Alternative**:
	* Arcade Fire - "Wake Up" (126 BPM)
	* The 1975 - "Girls" (128 BPM)
	* Two Door Cinema Club - "Sun" (130 BPM)
	* The Neighbourhood - "Sweater Weather" (124 BPM)
	* Capital Cities - "Safe and Sound" (128 BPM)
3. **Electronic/Dance**:
	* Daft Punk - "Technologic" (128 BPM)
	* Justice - "D.A.N.C.E." (128 BPM)
	* Passion Pit - "Take a Walk" (130 BPM)
	* Chromeo - "Night by Night" (128 BPM)
	* Moby - "Lift Me Up" (128 BPM)
4. **Classic Rock/Pop**:
	* Queen - "Another One Bites the Dust" (128 BPM)
	* The Police - "Message in a Bottle" (128 BPM)
	* Fleetwood Mac - "Go Your Own Way" (124 BPM)
	* The Cars - "Just What I Needed" (128 BPM)
	* Tom Petty - "Running Down a Dream" (126 BPM)

These songs should provide a consistent beat and tempo to match your leisurely 5-mile jog pace. You can also experiment with songs that have a slightly faster or slower tempo to find the perfect fit for your jogging style.

Remember to consider Rachel's music preferences as well, and feel free to add or remove songs to create the perfect playlist for your jogging duo!
